channel.title: Comments on: Sony – Evil Company #2 To Feature On This Blog
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: It could be, and if it turns out to be a bogus item, I'll post an apology. Right now, although I imagine Sony PR people heard about this, nothing was heard from Sony with regards to this issue.
item.content:encoded: It could be, and if it turns out to be a bogus item, I’ll post an apology. Right now, although I imagine Sony PR people heard about this, nothing was heard from Sony with regards to this issue.

item.title: By: Ariel Cohen
item.dc:creator: Ariel Cohen
item.description: How do you know that this screw in the photo is realy the "screw special"? Maybe it's a gig
item.content:encoded: How do you know that this screw in the photo is realy the “screw special”? Maybe it’s a gig

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
Right... so I found the same 38$ price: http://www.geekzone.co.nz/freitasm/2984 But that's distribution price. If you consider the distributer addition, the price is even higher.
But let's say the price is only 38$. Don't you think that's a lot for a simple (albeit special) screw?
item.content:encoded:
Right… so I found the same 38$ price:
http://www.geekzone.co.nz/freitasm/2984
But that’s distribution price. If you consider the distributer addition, the price is even higher.

But let’s say the price is only 38$. Don’t you think that’s a lot for a simple (albeit special) screw?

item.title: By: Ariel Cohen
item.dc:creator: Ariel Cohen
item.description: Can you find a web site (with the screw's picture) where it is sold for that price? I could only find it for $38, with no picture of the screw and it actualy seems to be related with speakers and not ps3.
item.content:encoded: Can you find a web site (with the screw’s picture) where it is sold for that price? I could only find it for $38, with no picture of the screw and it actualy seems to be related with speakers and not ps3.

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: I realize that Microsoft tactics for consumer lock-in are awful, to say the least. But: 1. I think Microsoft is getting better over time, and they will get better because market forces will make them get better 2. I can't honestly bash Microsoft while I'm still using their products at home. Maybe when I'll make the switch :)
item.content:encoded:
I realize that Microsoft tactics for consumer lock-in are awful, to say the least.
But:
1. I think Microsoft is getting better over time, and they will get better because market forces will make them get better
2. I can’t honestly bash Microsoft while I’m still using their products at home. Maybe when I’ll make the switch :)

item.title: By: rom
item.dc:creator: rom
item.description: I'm talking about extending the standard so only ms tools can understand it. Html which comes from word is an example
item.content:encoded: I’m talking about extending the standard so only ms tools can understand it. Html which comes from word is an example

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description:
rom: I have mixed feelings about Microsoft... as a monopoly they use business tactics that aren't friendly. But as a developer for Microsoft I felt as if they were doing good things so that you'll be able to relatively easily develop for the various versions of Windows. These things are somewhat related: if you set the standard you can also provide the best development tools.
xtreeq: Yep... that's a funny one.
item.content:encoded:
rom: I have mixed feelings about Microsoft… as a monopoly they use business tactics that aren’t friendly. But as a developer for Microsoft I felt as if they were doing good things so that you’ll be able to relatively easily develop for the various versions of Windows. These things are somewhat related: if you set the standard you can also provide the best development tools.

xtreeq: Yep… that’s a funny one.

item.title: By: xtreeq
item.dc:creator: xtreeq
item.content:encoded:
Best comment:
“I’ve paid a lot more than that for a screw.”

Gotta love it…

item.title: By: rom
item.dc:creator: rom
item.description: Is microsoft in too? I mean, they also love to create they own standards....
item.content:encoded: Is microsoft in too? I mean, they also love to create they own standards….
